description:
Checks which elements of `x` are valid (*`x IS NULL`*). Valid values are all finite numerical values (excluding NaN according to [IEEE Standard 754](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/4610935)), which are not nodata values according to ``is_nodata()``.

The operand can be a scalar number or a datacube.


The result is a scalar number if the operand is scalar, and otherwise a datacube. Operand elements which are null result in a null element in the result.

The element type of the result depends on the element type of the operand:

```
| operand type   | result type   |
|----------------|---------------|
| X              | bool          |
```

returns.description: True where `x` is valid, false otherwise.

links.title: Documentation on induced operations in rasdaman

wcps: <x> != nan and x is not null
